definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: He writes simply and succinctly, rarely adding too much adornment.
sentences.chinese: 朴实简练，很少添加饰词。

sentences.english: The 'broken windows' theory of crime prevention has never been so drastically condensed.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪预防的“破窗”理论从来都不曾如此彻底的简练。

sentences.english: The simple and clean silhouette represents the adamancy and beauty of Geisha.
sentences.chinese: 以简练的线条传达艺伎的坚强与美丽。

sentences.english: This balladry spoke the four seasons succinctly also to wash crural benefit.
sentences.chinese: 此民谣也简练地道出了四季洗脚的益处。

sentences.english: Your movements during exercise should be slow and concise.
sentences.chinese: 在运动中你的动作应该是缓慢和简练的。

sentences.english: The writer managed to distil his ideas into one succinct article.
sentences.chinese: 作家努力把他的想法浓缩成一篇简练的文章。

sentences.english: brevity is the soul of wit.
The book is well written, properly illustrated and excellently captioned.
sentences.chinese: 这本书写得很好，插图生动形象，说明文字简练精辟。

sentences.english: It really motivates you to write very tight and concise documentation.
sentences.chinese: 它促使您编写更加严密和简练的文档资料。
刚健的文字都是简练的。

sentences.english: The writer managed to distil his ideas into one succinct article .
sentences.chinese: 作家努力把他的想法浓缩成一篇简练的文章。

sentences.english: But really, I do love your four-word proverbs and idioms. They are so succinct and expressive.
sentences.chinese: 不过，我确实喜欢你们的四字成语，简练而生动。

sentences.english: The brief rhythm says no late, no indisposition.
sentences.chinese: 简练的节奏在说没有迟到，没有早退。

sentences.english: Writing pithy and informative titles is an art form.
sentences.chinese: 写出简练而带有情报性的标题是一种艺术形式。

sentences.english: Its contour succinct simple, does not have the excessive ostentatiousness.
sentences.chinese: 其外形简练朴素，没有过度的浮华。

definition: variant of 簡練|简练[jian3 lian4]
to suggest (rather than depict in detail)/freehand style of Chinese painting, characterized by bold strokes rather than accurate details
to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
to link up (disparate elements)/coherent (narrative, argument etc)
(textiles) to scour/to degum (silk)/variant of 精煉|精炼[jing1 lian4]
